title: 2 Simple Ways to Download and Add Worlds on Minecraft

steps.title: Download the world
steps.content: Download the world you want to add. Select the world, and then look for a Download button. The file should install as a .ZIP, .RAR, or .mcworld file. Make sure you're downloading from a trusted source, and treat the file as you would any other files from third parties. If you don't have an antivirus scanner , it's recommended to download one to scan for threats. Some trusted sites include: CurseForge Planet Minecraft Minecraft Maps Minecraft Forums .

steps.title: Locate the .mcworld file.
steps.content: Locate the .mcworld file. If the file is in .ZIP or .RAR format, change the extension to .mcworld. [1] X Research source For example, rename "worldname.zip" to "worldname.mcworld".

steps.title: Double-click the .mcworld file.
steps.content: Double-click the .mcworld file. It should have a Minecraft icon. Minecraft should open with the new world. If this doesn't work, see the next method.

steps.title: Download the world you want to add.
steps.content: Download the world you want to add. Select the world, and then look for a Download button. The file should install as a .ZIP or .RAR file. Make sure you're downloading from a trusted source, and treat the file as you would any other files from third parties. If you don't have an antivirus scanner, it's recommended to download one to scan for threats. Some trusted sites include: CurseForge Planet Minecraft Minecraft Maps Minecraft Forums .

steps.title: Extract the world.
steps.content: Extract the world. On Windows, you can do this by opening the folder and selecting Extract All . On Mac, double-click the file to unzip it. Save the unzipped folder to your desktop for easy access.

steps.title: Find your Minecraft folder.
steps.content: Find your Minecraft folder. This will vary depending on your device and your past settings. You can usually find the folder: Windows : %APPDATA%\.minecraft Mac : ~/Library/Application Support/minecraft Linux : ~/.minecraft

steps.title: Open the "Saves" folder (Java Edition).
steps.content: Open the "Saves" folder (Java Edition). On Bedrock Edition, this will be "minecraftWorlds".

steps.title: Move the extracted folder to the "Saves" folder.
steps.content: Move the extracted folder to the "Saves" folder. On Bedrock Edition, this is "minecraftWorlds".

steps.title: Launch Minecraft
steps.content: Launch Minecraft . You'll find your new world in the same place as your other saves. Select Singleplayer or Play . It may take some scrolling to find your new save. Once you find it, click it to start the new world.
